page.title: 16The Post Office, Bryanston
page.content: The village Post Office in Bryanston has in recent years made a reputation for itself as a supplier of quality groceries as well as the services of the Post Office. Its customers come from the village, the school, the immediate locality and beyond;one customer recently came from Durban.The shop specialises in coffee, which is roasted on the premises, and cheeses. It offers a wide range and is the biggest speciality buyer in the area, supplying from London importers. Recently the shop acquired a license for the sale of wines, and specialises in South African wines.The Post Office supplies newspapers which means that the day starts at 6.30 a.m. and goes on to 6.30 p.m. Shop hours are 9-1 & 2-5.30,except Mondays,and Sundays 9-1. Running a Post Office also means helping people to fill in forms.
